titleInfo.title: Letter from William Bruce, Acting Resident at Bushire to Jonathan Duncan, President and Governor in Council, Bombay

mods.abstract: The letter concerns the appearance of piracy in the Gulf and outlines a report that part of the Joasimese tribe have put nine boats to sea to deter or tackle pirates; Mahomud Jaffer Khan [Muḥammad Ja‘afar Khān] has offered to assist with the object of this mission. The letter further notes that Captain Sealey intends for the Benaresto travel to friendly ports throughout the Gulf with requests that vessels provide assistance to these boats as opportunities arise. Also mentioned are measures William Bruce has taken to assist the Benareswith its mission.
